pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.5: “Are you all present” render samaggāttha, lit. “are you united”. Sp.2.149: Samaggātthāti sabbā āgatatthāti attho, “Are you united: the meaning is ‘Have you all come?’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.3.4: That osāreti must mean “recite” can be seen from bhikkhu-pācittiya 4 where there is no offense if osārentaṁ opāteti, “he prompts one who is osārentaṁ.” The difference between uddesaṃ deti and osāreti is not clear to me.
